attributes.action: Pay married women a pension based on contributions made through the reduced stamp.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Thousands of married women have paid a reduced stamp, thinking they would get a pension based on their husband's contributions.  However, they have to wait until their husband reaches retirement age until they get anything.  Why can't they get a pension based on their own contributions.  What exactly was the money used for. You could not claim unemployment benefit or sickness benefits.  You could get exactly the same by not working at all.
